They are the most awesome looking lamps...ever....*drool*

Actually I just want a replica...I can't afford 18K polished gold-plated finished lamps...

I heard about this little 4 year old girl who has stage 4 neuroblastoma from a friend a couple of months back. Her story was even more compelling to me because her mother is a single mother who is trying very hard to save her daughter's life. And turns out, her father's a heartless dick. You can read more about her story at Our Fiesty Princess and at her blog. I've been following the progress of the little girl's journey through her blog for quite a while. And I'm truly and truly amazed at how things have progressed and how helpful and generous Singaporeans have been. I think initially she just had the blog and some people donated through the blog but they weren't making much progress towards the S$5 million they were trying to raise. And then the media found out about her and since then I think it's really grown into this huge huge fundraising drive. People started donating and selling things on forums to raise money, people who ran businesses online started donating part of their proceeds to her, members of Hardwarezone forum also started collecting money for her with even one anonymous person saying that he/she would match $1 to $1 donations up to S$10k and someone even organised a photo shoot for people's pets to raise money. Truly truly amazing..I never thought I'd see anything like this...Singaporeans really got up and started helping and not just by giving money but some people really went out of their way and started mini fundraising events on their own. People talk about how Singaporeans are not gracious and we're all kind of selfish...and you know I always kind of agreed. I always thought everyone was just going about their own lives and doing their own thing and not really bothering about the community around them, the people around them and everyone just better not get in their way. But look at how wrong I've been! This has grown into something which I think Charmaine's mother and friends didn't even imagine. I didn't imagine this could happen when I first started following her blog and sharing the link on my facebook and with my friends. There was a celebrity soccer match with the Dream Team of Singapore from Malaysia Cup days (Fandhi Ahmad, Nazri Nasir, Abbas Saad!!), there is now a sort of advertisement of her site calling for help for her by Jamie Ong, Oli Pettigrew and Eunice Olsen on AXN, and just today I saw that there is going to be an event at Zouk (sponsored by Zouk and many others) for Charmaine! I can't even begin to describe how amazed and fascinated I am by how things have turned out. I'm also really happy for Charmaine and her family. Because this must be so great to have so many people care and so many people wanting to help in their time of despair and hardship. It must be so overwhelming...Charmaine's mother is one strong strong person to be handling all this. I know I've said this already and used this word several times but..I am really really amazed...and also really proud of my fellow Singaporeans (as cheesy as that sounds)! Stay strong and fight on Charmaine and family! So many people are behind you and rooting for you!
Can't believe another year has gone by..........

I had an awesome birthday this year!!

Dinner at Barracks on the 19th with The Gang, D and W was crazy fun!! The food was really yummy, we got D to dance for us (which was hilarious!) and we saw  and 's amazing ability to chug beer.

Then on the 21st i had brunch at Braise with L and S. The brunch menu at Braise was goooood..I was so stuffed. You get to share around 7 appetizers with your table, pick 1 egg dish, 1 main course and a dessert. And you can also choose a free flow sangria menu!

After that I had dinner with the family at Shunjuu. So it's really been a weekend of overeating.

Here's a rundown of the FABULOUS presents I got this year:

1) Red Christian Louboutins pumps from Baby (my first ever CLs!!)

2) Sex and the City Seasons 1 - 6 box set that came in this gorgeous pink velvet cover (I have wanted this for a VERY long time)

3) Sex and the City movie DVD (Chris Noh is so hot)

4) Dark Knight DVD (Christian Bale is so hot)

5) A pink and gold velvet leopard print clutch (kind of hooker which is completely awesome)

6) Hello Kitty mahjong tiles (even has a special LV damier inspired box!!!)

YAY!! I felt super super loved this year and I was really really happy over the weekend. It was just so nice on the 19th when so many people were sending me birthday smses and messages on Facebook..*beam* It was really nice.

I did have a slight panic attack at one point on the morning of the 19th when I realised I am now on the wrong side of 25. Depressing....but it's ok..i have found the solution to it. The most powerful thing in the whole wide world..Denial.

I decided I turned 25 (again) this year. So...can't wait for my next 25th birthday!! Wheeee...

the house is really coming along. we popped in yesterday to meet with the curtains/carpets/wallpaper people and we're really excited with the progress of the place. it's amazing how much they can do in just 2 weeks. we also got a whole bunch of stuff for our house yesterday so me and Baby are feeling extremely broke. but we're feeling quite pleased and can't wait for everything to be done. i'm a little stressed about budget because everything is costing us alot more than what we expected.

when we were in Vienna we went into a store called Kare and we just LOVED their stuff. we really wanted to buy a ton of furniture and stuff back but had no idea how we were going to lug them around Europe so we didn't. so we were very happy when we found a place in Singapore that carried some Kare product. the shop is called Poseidon at Liang Court. of course the prices are marked up by quite abit which kinda sucks because part of the reason why we loved Kare in Vienna so much was because the stuff was very affordable!! you could get a gorgeous full length mirror for about Euros 59.90. it was like Ikea but much better designs and quality. but bo pian so we just bought what was within our budget at Poseidon but we're so happy with the stuff! the best thing we got was a set of espresso cups and saucers that have skulls on them!! awesome......

Baby saw this old school looking gramophone at Poseidon that could play records, cds, dvds..it had FM/AM radio..it was SO cool. i think he really wants it but we just don't have the space for it in our place.

this whole home decorating thing is really fun but I'm worried man...cos I really don't need another thing to spend money on!! sigh..no more Chanel for me for at least 2 months...

We had our PC test early early this morning at the Mandai Executive Golf Course which is a 9-hole course. 

Here we are just before we stepped on the course!!


My theory is the less pro we look, the less expectations people will have of us. And I didn't buy that visor, my mother did.

I thought we did a pretty good job considering this was our first time on the course. 3 of us finished in slightly less than 2 hours although that might be due to our instructor rushing us along and not letting us putt our balls into the hole once we got our balls closer to the hole and kept going "ok gimme gimme. pick up your ball". But we didn't lose too many balls and I didn't dig too many holes in the ground and I think that's good!! 

But today also made me realise what a mafan affair it is to play golf! You need the clubs, the club covers, the shoes, the gloves, the cap, the sunglasses, the different height tees, the balls, a cloth to clean the balls and clubs, the markers, the sun block, the score cards, the pencils...the list just goes on and on. Baby and me squeezed about 12 clubs (6 each) into one small bag and we had such a hard time getting the clubs in and out of the bag and trying to juggle the extra balls and tees and the score cards!! It was so stressful coz we were also being rushed along by our instructor and there was a flight behind us! We need to get better equipped and better organised the next time we play man...

Kinda looking forward to playing again!

My PC test is tomorrow! Although I know that it's very unlikely our instructor will fail us, I'm still kinda nervous! 

I really hope I don't suck too badly tomorrow coz we had a practice session just now at the Marina driving range and I was baaaaaaaad. And all I was really aiming for was to hit the bloody little white round bugger cleanly. I wouldn't even have minded if it didn't fly that far! It's terribly demoralising...I wonder if it's against some golf etiquette if I start cursing on the course. 

I am looking forward to getting all the cute pink golf accessories I can find. That is my only motivation for carrying on with this game. I am also very tempted to bling out my current golf shoes. Cos if I'm gonna suck at the game, the least I can do is look cute (and completely frivolous) doing it!! And also have pretty shiny things to distract me and hopefully prevent me from pounding the ground with my golf club or throwing it across the green.

Two years after we reached home dazed and wondering what the hell we just did (we just bought an apartment), our place has finally TOP-ed a year earlier than expected!!

And after about a month of seeing different interior designers and agonising over the cost of renovations, how we would like the house to look like, whether we should hire an interior designer or just go to a contractor and "design" ourselves and which interior designer we should go with, today we finally made a decision and hired an interior designer with an option to take his designs and find our own contractor if we find his construction prices too high!! 

We then spent the rest of the afternoon looking at furniture at Harvey Norman at Millenia, Space and Egg3! 

Here are some photos of a sofa and a dining table we like which I sneakily took from Harvey Norman!


Real classy grown up looking sofa eh?


Table with BLING on it!! It's meant to be!

 

We're so excited!! But I am also feeling very sad because I don't know if I can bear to move out...I will miss my mummy!!!

So I am bored bored bored bored..Just staring at the wall and surfing the internet aimlessly and randomly...

Rafael Nadal is guaranteed to claim the No. 1 South African Airways ATP Ranking this month after reaching the semifinals at the Western & Southern Financial Group Masters with a 7-6(3), 6-1 victory over Ecuadorian Nicolas Lapentti on Friday night.

The 22-year-old Spaniard will replace Roger Federer as the new World No. 1 player in the South African Airways ATP Rankings this month. The timing of Nadal's rise to No. 1 depends on his results in Cincinnati:

- If Nadal wins the title, he will become No. 1 this Monday.
- If Nadal loses in the final he will become No. 1 on August 11
- If Nadal loses in the semifinals he will become No. 1 on August 18

Federer has held the top ranking a record 235 consecutive weeks (since Feb. 2, 2004) and Nadal has been No. 2 for a record 158 straight weeks (since July 25, 2005). The last player to rank No. 1 before Federer's reign was Andy Roddick the week of Jan. 26, 2004.

The Spaniard will become the 24th player in the history of the South African Airways ATP Rankings (since 1973) to hold the No. 1 position. He will join countrymen Carlos Moya (1999) and Juan Carlos Ferrero (2003) to rank No. 1.

Nadal, who also won his career-best 32nd consecutive match on Friday, has reached the semifinals or better in all nine ATP Masters Series tournaments in his career. He will attempt to become the first player to reach the final in all nine when he plays World No. 3 Novak Djokovic in the semifinals on Saturday. Nadal leads the all-time series 9-3, winning the last three meetings this year.

I got paid yesterday!! Wheee!! 

I don't remember what I was so unhappy about now...maybe I'll remember again in 2 weeks (after I have spent everything)...

After much agonising (mainly due to our shock at how much a wedding costs and a desire to be sensible people), we have confirmed 3 of the 5 biggest wedding decisions we have to make. Let me say first that I don't necessarily think we finally managed to be sensible people (and I think I might be the one to blame).

We have fixed a date. 12 and 13 December 2009. People write it down. I tell you a year and a half in advance so no excuses for missing it.

We have booked our banquet venue. It will be a lunch banquet at Conrad International Centennial Hotel.

We have booked our main photographers. Oneeyeclick  for our pre-wedding shots and William Chua for our actual day shots. 

The remaining 2 decisions are the solemnisation venue and our bridal package. We've pretty much decided that solemnisation will be at our church and our bridal package will be with Frederick Lee (whose assistance remembers me because I brought the, and I quote, "goooooreeeeous husband"). We just need to get down to confirming these.

There are of course still a TON of things that need to be done like deciding on where we're going to have our friend's dinner, a videographer (if any), a photographer for the banquet lunch (because we can't afford to get William on both days), how I am going to squeeze Bestest Friend into a baby pink suit etc etc etc. But we feel good that we've got these big things out of the way. Now we're just really looking forward to the house TOP-ing and starting on the renovations and stuff.

We celebrated Sarah's 1st birthday today!! 

She's grown so much in the last year and she's changed so much..she's running now and it's amazing watching her learn and discover things. 
I bought her a little Baby Disney Princess car that has all sorts of buttons that make noises and plays music. 

I'm exhausted though...last I saw Sarah she was still going strong and having fun with her pressies..

golf so far. 

Right now..I am thinking I hate it. 

I had my first lesson on the recent Sunday and Baby wanted to go to the driving range today after work. So we went. 

I don't get this game! Baby kept giving me all these instructions...go forward abit..go backward abit..don't open your feet so wide..don't hunch (altho I caught him hunching too!!)..lean forward..your arms are too straight (but the coach said STRAIGHT!!). 

And then I couldn't figure out of I was using strength or not because I didn't feel like I was and I certainly wasn't trying to but everytime I missed the ball or hit it badly I would grunt which was a sign I must have used strength. 

I just don't get it....it seems like it is a game with very specific technique and yet it is not possible to very precisely determine how straight my damn arms are supposed to be or exactly how far away from the ball I am supposed to be!! 

And this does not sit well with me...if you tell me my arms are supposed to be straight..don't tell me "not so straight". There is no such thing as "not so straight"!! Either it is straight or it is not! 

You know I am quite happy to be the lady in the big hat and sunglasses sitting in the country club cafe having tea and flipping through Harper's Bazaar while my husband is out there in the sun hitting a tiny ball around with a long thin stick. 

Instead I am going to be the one smashing my own long thin stick to bits out in the big green field while screaming bloody murder. The only thing I am really looking forward to right now are those pink golf balls I saw in the shop the other day.

For some reason that I now cannot remember I suddenly thought of watching the video of Absolut Rouge, the dance production TH Dance did at Zouk when I was dance head.

I cringed when I saw myself in those $10 budget self made costumes I had on and when I saw myself dancing (I looked awful) and laughed when I heard the few comments made by the audience  which the camera managed to pick up. But most of all I was amazed that we managed to pull the whole thing off.  

I of course can't remember now exactly how much work was involved although I think there really was quite abit. We were a committee of about 40 NUS students with more than half who were joining a dance committee for the first time. We did as many external performances as we could to raise funds, we had a marketing team who managed to get hair and make-up sponsorship and if I remember correctly a little bit of cash sponsorship (which required the entire committee's efforts to collect contacts for the insurance company), we had a fairly big (well big considering we were such a small committee) marketing campaign within the hall and around NUS, we produced a dance show at Zouk with a storyline with 10 dances and everyone in the committee performed. And at the end of the year, we had covered all expenses including the Zouk booking fee, costumes and props and we had money to spare! 

It was a simply storyline of bad boy and good girl get engaged, boy goes to club and hooks up with bad girl, good girl goes to club and sees them together and is heartbroken, good girl decides to be bad too and goes to club to confront bad girl, cat fight happens and just before bad girl slaps good girl boy steps in, bad girl slaps boy and goes off in a huff, bad boy begs for good girl's forgiveness which after some grovelling by him she gives. 

I could hear the audience laughing, gasping when good girl sees boy and bad girl together, going "Orrrhhhhhh" when good girl appears to confront bag girl and cheering when boy gets slapped by bad girl. I remember one of my committee members telling me that someone overhead some people in the toilet during the interval complaining about how the bad boy could cheat on good girl. That the audience was drawn into the storyline and the whole show was everything that I had hoped for and so much more than I could have asked for. 

I forgot how wonderful it was that the show was a success but watching the video again and thinking back, I think we were insane to have even attempted it and I'm so amazed and proud that we did it. No wonder my grades were so shit that year but so worth it. 

I feel so much prouder of the person I was back then than I have been of myself the last 2 years. Ahhh...to be young, determined and adventurous again..

It's been yonks since I went out partying..altho it wasn't so much partying as it was standing around having drinks and yelling Happy Birthday at several people in the group...ah well...I ain't as young as I used to be anymore...

My third bro is leaving his current job and joining another company. He's clearing leave this three weeks so our house is currently the House of the Unemployed.

And it was a fun day on Tuesday at the House of the Unemployed!!

Ok so here is how I spent yesterday: 

11am - Woke up 

12pm - Arrived at Parkway for lunch and walk around Borders to use up 20% discount voucher (bought a Jamie Oliver cookbook) 

1pm - Mani/Pedi 

2:30pm - Left Parkway

3pm - 5:30pm - Prepared and got ready for interview 

6pm - Reached Parkview Square early. Went to grab a bite 

6:30pm - Interview 

7:45pm - Finished interview. Left Parkview Square 

8pm - Picked up Baby to go Tampines for dinner and to watch Indiana Jones 

9pm - Watched Indiana Jones (I thought it was alright altho Baby, who is a fan of the series, was disappointed. Don't go in with huge expectations man...it's a 65 year old Harrison Ford) 

We finished the movie, came home, I watched 3 episodes of Friends and fell asleep dreaming of people locking me up because they thought I was crazy and force feeding me medication. Andy you visited me and tried to get me out...good friend!! 

I know the day doesn't sound like much and I even wondered what I managed to accomplish but it felt like a VERY full day!! How did I ever manage to do all the things I had to do AND work at the same time?? No wonder I was exhausted and cranky. 

Preparing for another interview tomorrow now. Two interviews in one week...super sianz.

I'm back. Boo. Don't wanna be back. 

I was just getting better in Europe. I wanna be back in Europe!! 

How did 2 weeks fly by so quickly????????

Off the Vienna in 14 hours!! Wheee!! 

See you guys two weeks later!!

We went by to check out our place yesterday! It's looking good!





Our unit is the one with the yellow bucket looking thing on the balcony.

I just spoke to the developer and they said that they anticipate TOP in January 2009 (maybe even December 2008)! I can't wait to get our place!!

So excited!!

I'm falling sick!! 

This is not suppose to happen during Melissa's Awesome Time of Unemployment!!

I am exhausted!! 

Body is aching from yoga yesterday...Prakash's classes are very good but I usually want to die during and the day after class. And feeling incredibly sleepy the whole day and suspect it is the body wanting more rest after yesterday's class. 

I've actually been pretty busy doing all sorts of things which I don't really get a chance to do while I am employed. Like pack my room, catching up with people, planning my Europe trip etc etc. 

I am really trying to get myself to chill out and stop trying to fill every minute of the day like I have to make the full use of the day because I have to go to work again soon and I won't know when I will have free time again.  

I need to de-crazy myself. I've become a completely high strung crazy ass angry bitch over the last 2 years and I need to go back to becoming just a crazy ass angry bitch....

Woke up at 12:30pm. 

Went to Parkway with Mummy and baby Sarah and spent the whole afternoon there having lunch and buying baby stuff and groceries. 

Came home and packed room for abit. 

Went to Ikea with Mummy, baby Sarah and Big Bro and had dinner and walked round for abit. 

Came home to Baby. 

So far unemployment rocks.

That's it. 

I'm officially unemployed. 

Who wants to buy me food?

There's a grief that can't be spoken.
There's a pain goes on and on.
Empty chairs at empty tables
Now my friends are dead and gone.

Here they talked of revolution.
Here it was they lit the flame.
Here they sang about `tomorrow'
And tomorrow never came.

From the table in the corner
They could see a world reborn
And they rose with voices ringing
I can hear them now!
The very words that they had sung
Became their last communion
On the lonely barricade at dawn.

Oh my friends, my friends forgive me

That I live and you are gone.
There's a grief that can't be spoken.
There's a pain goes on and on.

Phantom faces at the window.
Phantom shadows on the floor.
Empty chairs at empty tables
Where my friends will meet no more.

Oh my friends, my friends, don't ask me
What your sacrifice was for
Empty chairs at empty tables
Where my friends will sing no more.

This song always makes me cry. I LOVE this musical even though I have never watched it! I couldn't afford tickets when they came to Singapore and settled with buying the soundtrack and really just fell in love with this musical just by listening to the songs.

I really hope to get to watch it one day. I think I will be a sobbing mess when I finally get to watch it.
